intro: Polygala irregularis var. aegyptiaca, commonly known as the Egyptian milk-vetch, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of North Africa and the Middle East. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters. The plant features slender, branched stems and small, clustered flowers that are usually pale yellow or greenish-white. Its leaves are alternate, linear, and often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions.
